piece_description: This is my most recent art piece. It's a painting of Alicia Keys (unfinished). Fun fact: My printer bugged out and created a peach-like color for part of the background and I thought it was pretty cool so I kept it
My first attempt at a watercolor painting, in which I just used watered down tempera paint. For a while I had it framed and ironically hanging up in my room as if it was actually worth something
A charcoal drawing of me. It was featured in the invitation for the Winter art exhibit at my first college in 2018
A simple bones still life piece in color pastels. Did this one in highschool

The plan was to create a replica of the Titanic movie drawing. I was going to rip it up a bit and dye it in coffee but I chickened out because I didn't want to ruin it. I guess I could've (and still could) just make copies and do a few test runs
Another highschool still life drawing. This one was done with regular graphite. I named it “fish-vase.” I know, I'm so creative, thanks
Kind of an odd piece I think. Those bags and leaves were attached to a wall and our task was to pick an interesting spot and draw it in color pastels. I guess I achieved the task

Hey look, yet another still life drawing! I'm not sure what I named this one but since I'm the artist I guess I could just rename it. Lets say omething like “foot-face” or maybe “Piescara” to seem more sophisticated

This was the first time I did stippling and I used sharpies. There's something I still want to try to fix but I wont get into that now (left side of bowling pin). Other than that, I think it looks pretty decent
